meanings.definition: To bend low with the limbs close to the body.
meanings.sent1: The cat crouched before pouncing on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent2: She crouched down to tie her shoelaces.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel crouched comically to fit into the tiny box.
meanings.sent4: The soldier crouched like a tiger ready to strike.
meanings.sent5: The ninja crouched silently in the shadows, waiting for the signal.

meanings.sent1: The child crouched to pick up the fallen ball.
meanings.sent2: He crouched under the low-hanging branch to avoid hitting his head.
meanings.sent3: The clown crouched playfully to entertain the children.
meanings.sent4: The old man crouched like a question mark, lost in thought.
meanings.sent5: The athlete crouched at the starting line, ready for the race to begin.

meanings.definition: To lower the body stance by bending the legs.
meanings.sent1: The frog crouched before leaping into the pond.
meanings.sent2: She crouched slightly to get a better view of the stage.
meanings.sent3: The robot crouched awkwardly, trying to mimic human movements.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches crouched under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent5: The detective crouched behind the bushes, observing the suspect's movements.
